class.name: HTMLTemplateData
class.description:
Stores HTML template data for [HTMLTemplate]s. It uses a cusom format, which should make it easy to edit. Create files using the [code].phtpl[/code] (Pandemonium HTML Template) file extenstion, the editor will import those files as this class. Double clicking on them will directly open them in the Text Editor (if available). The [code].phtpl[/code] file format looks a bit similar to config files, except it's a lot simpler. For example: [code]
[ Head ]
... Head html here
[ Content ]
... Content html here
[ Shell ]
... Shell html here
[/code] This file will be parsed as 3 key-value template strings. A key named [code]Head[/code] with the content [code]... Head html here[/code], a key named [code]Content[/code] with the content [code]... Content html here[/code] and a key named [code]Shell[/code] with the content [code]... Shell html here[/code]. Note: Make sure there is no whitespace before and after the square brackets of the section keys. Also note that white space will be stripped on both sides of the keys before storing them.

method.name: get_template
method.description: Gets the template string for the given name and returns it, or it returns an empty String if not found.

method.name: has_template
method.description: Checks whether the template string for the given name is available.

method.name: load_from_file
method.description: Loads data from a file using the [code].phtpl[/code] file format.

method.name: load_from_string
method.description: Loads data from a string using the [code].phtpl[/code] file format.

method.name: remove_template
method.description: Removes a set key value pair.

method.name: save_as_string
method.description: Saves data to a string using the [code].phtpl[/code] file format.

method.name: save_to_file
method.description: Saves data to a file using the [code].phtpl[/code] file format.

method.name: set_template
method.description: Sets a template key value pair.

members.member: Returns att stored templates as a Dictionary.
